sen.j: 日吉駅（ひよしえき）は、京都府南丹市日吉町 (京都府)にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）山陰本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Hiyoshicho, Nantan City, Kyoto Prefecture, Hiyoshi Station is a stop on the Sanin Main Line, which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Located in Hiyoshicho, Nantan City, Kyoto Prefecture, Hiyoshi Station is a stop on the Sanin Main Line, which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Located in Hiyoshi-cho, Nantan City, Kyoto Prefecture, Hiyoshi Station is a stop on the Sanin Main Line, which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: 旧日吉町の中心駅であった。
sen.e: The station served as a center of the old Hiyoshicho.
It was the central station of old Hiyoshicho.
sen.cmt: "The station served as a center of the"→"It was the central station of"
sen.e: It was the central station of old Hiyoshi-cho.

sen.j: 通勤利用客向けに、朝夕は特急列車の一部が停車する。
sen.e: Limited Express trains partly stop at Hiyoshi Station in the morning and evening for commuters.
Some Limited Express trains stop at Hiyoshi Station in the morning and evening for commuters.
Some Limited Express trains stop at Hiyoshi Station in the morning and evening for commuters.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 島式1面2線プラットホームを持つ、行違い可能な地上駅である。
sen.e: Hiyoshi Station is an aboveground station with a single platform serving two tracks that run in opposite directions, by which a train can pass another train.
Hiyoshi Station is an aboveground station with a single platform serving two tracks that run in opposite directions, allowing trains to pass each other.
sen.cmt: "by which a train can pass another train"→"allowing trains to pass each other"
sen.e: Hiyoshi Station is an aboveground station with a single platform serving two tracks that run in opposite directions, allowing trains to pass each other.

sen.j: 駅舎は南丹市日吉町の交流センターとの合築となっており、ホーム福知山寄りから構内踏切で繋がっている。
sen.e: The station building is shared with the Center for Hiyoshicho of Nantan City and can be accessed through the level crossing in the station from the Fukuchiyama side of the platform.
The station building is shared with the Hiyoshicho Transport Interchange and can be accessed from the level crossing on the Fukuchiyama side of the platform.
The station building is shared with the Nantan City Hiyoshi-cho Exchange Center and can be accessed from the level crossing on the Fukuchiyama side of the platform.
sen.cmt: ハイフン挿入Transport Interchange→Exchange CenterNantan City補足

sen.j: 簡易委託駅で旧駅舎時代から引き続きキヨスクが営業している。
sen.e: The station has been under consigned management of Kiosk since before the station moved into the current building.
Management of the station has been semi-subcontracted to Kiosk since before the station moved into the current building.
sen.cmt: "The station has been under consigned management of "→"Management of the station has been semi-subcontracted to"
sen.e: Management of the station has been semi-subcontracted to Kiosk since before the station moved into the current building.

sen.j: 1番のりばの福知山寄りが一線スルーとなっているが、1番のりばは主として特急の通過に使われ、停車列車は主に2番のりばに停車する。
sen.e: Hiyoshi Station adopts what is called a single track through system on the Fukuchiyama side of Track 1, where Track 1 is used mainly for the Limited Express trains that pass through the station, whereas Track 2 is used mainly for the trains that stop at the station.

Hiyoshi Station has a single track crossing loop configuration on the Fukuchiyama side of Track 1, where Track 1 is used mainly for the Limited Express trains that pass through the station and Track 2 is used mainly for trains that stop at the station.

Hiyoshi Station has a single track crossing loop configuration on the Fukuchiyama side of Platform 1, where Platform 1 is used mainly for the Limited Express trains that pass through the station and Platform 2 is used mainly for trains that stop at the station.

sen.j: 1番のりばへの停車があるのは普通列車同士の行違いの時や、上り停車特急に限られる。
sen.e: Trains enter Track 1 to stop at the station only when a Local train passes another Local train or when inbound Limited Express trains stop at the station.
Trains stop at Track 1 only when two Local trains pass or when inbound Limited Express trains stop at the station.
sen.cmt: "enter"→"stop at"Deleted "to stop at the station""a Local train passes another Local train"→"two Local trains pass"
sen.e: Trains stop at Platform 1 only when two Local trains pass or when inbound Limited Express trains stop at the station.

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Number of passengers
Passenger Volume
Passenger Volume

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約375人である。
sen.e: The number of passengers per day was about 375 people in 2006.
The number of passengers per day was about 375 people in 2006.
The number of passengers per day was about 375 people in fiscal year 2006.
sen.cmt: in fiscal year 2006 としました。

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (adapted from Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book)
(adapted from the Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(adapted from the Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)

Station surroundings

sen.e: Nantan City Office, Hiyoshi Branch
Nantan City Office, Hiyoshi Branch
Nantan City Office, Hiyoshi Branch

sen.e: Tonoda Elementary School, Nantan City
Tonoda Elementary School, Nantan City

sen.e: Tonoda Junior High School, Nantan City
Tonoda Junior High School, Nantan City

sen.e: Hiyoshi Post Office
Hiyoshi Post Office
Hiyoshi Post Office

sen.j: 京都府道50号京都日吉美山線
sen.e: Kyoto prefectural road No. 50, Kyoto Hiyoshi Miyama Route
Kyoto prefectural road No. 50, Kyoto Hiyoshi Miyama Route
Kyoto prefectural road No. 50, Kyoto Hiyoshi Miyama Route

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）8月25日 - 日本国有鉄道の殿田駅（とのだえき）として開業。
sen.e: On August 25, 1910 Hiyoshi Station was opened as Tonoda Station, operated by Japan National Railways (JNR).
August 25, 1910 - Tonoda Station opened, operated by Japan National Railways (JNR).
August 25, 1910: Tonoda Station opened, operated by Japan National Railways (JNR).

sen.j: 客貨取扱を開始。
sen.e: The passenger and freight services began.
Start of passenger and freight services.
Start of passenger and freight services.

sen.j: 1984年（昭和59年）1月21日 - 貨物取扱を廃止。
sen.e: The freight service was discontinued on January 21, 1984.
January 21, 1984 - Freight service discontinued.
January 21, 1984: Freight service discontinued.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1987 the station came to be operated by the JR West as a result of division and privatization of JNR.
April 1, 1987 - Station taken over JR West following division and privatization of JNR.
April 1, 1987: Station taken over JR West following division and privatization of JNR.

sen.j: 1996年（平成8年）3月16日 - 日吉駅に改称。
sen.e: Tonoda Station was renamed Hiyoshi Station on March 16, 1996.
March 16, 1996 - Tonoda Station renamed Hiyoshi Station.
March 16, 1996: Tonoda Station renamed Hiyoshi Station.

sen.j: 隣の駅
sen.e: Neighboring stations
Neighboring stations
Neighboring stations

sen.j: ※当駅に一部が停車する特急「たんば (列車)」「はしだて (列車)」「まいづる (列車)」（「たんば」は上り、「はしだて」は下りのみ）の停車駅は各列車記事を参照のこと。
sen.e: *Limited Express 'Tanba,' 'Hashidate,' and 'Maizuru' ('Tanba' is an inbound train and 'Hashidate' is an outbound train) partly stop at Hiyoshi Station; refer to individual descriptions of trains as to the stops of these trains.

* The Limited Expresses 'Tanba,' 'Hashidate,' and 'Maizuru' ('Tanba' is an inbound train and 'Hashidate' is an outbound train) occasionally stop at Hiyoshi Station; refer to the individual descriptions of these trains for the stations they stop at.
sen.cmt: Added "the"Made "Express" plural"partly"→"occasionally"Added "the" and "these""the stops of these trains"→"the stations they stop at"
sen.e: * The Limited Expresses 'Tanba,' 'Hashidate,' and 'Maizuru' ('Tanba' is an inbound train and 'Hashidate' is an outbound train) occasionally stop at Hiyoshi Station; refer to the individual descriptions of these trains for the stations they stop at.

sen.e: Sanin Main Line
Sanin Main Line

sen.j: 船岡駅 (京都府) - 日吉駅 - 鍼灸大学前駅
sen.e: Funaoka Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Hiyoshi Station - Shinkyudaigakumae Station
Funaoka Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Hiyoshi Station - Shinkyudaigakumae Station
Funaoka Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Hiyoshi Station - Shinkyudaigakumae Station

sen.j: ここから福井県小浜市の小浜駅へ向かう小鶴線を分岐させる計画があった。
sen.e: There was a plan to construct Kotsuru Line that runs from Hiyoshi Station to Obama Station located in Obama City, Fukui Prefecture.
There was a plan to construct the Kotsuru Line, running from Hiyoshi Station to Obama Station in Obama City, Fukui Prefecture.
There was a plan to construct the Kotsuru Line, running from Hiyoshi Station to Obama Station in Obama City, Fukui Prefecture.
